docs.abstract: Jim Rutenberg Mediator column describes how more than $12 billion spent by Comcast and NBC to secure broadcast rights for Olympics from 2014 through 2032 is now making sense in light of profits from ad sales and changing nature of how people watch television.

headline.main: Betting Billions on Rio, Comcast Hopes to Win the Future of Television

docs.snippet: Rowing is one the oldest Olympics sports, a test of teamwork and endurance often played out in spectacular venues. The 2016 Olympic Rowing Regatta, as it is officially called, gets underway in Rio de Janeiro on Saturday. Here is a beginner's guide...

docs.snippet: When Merrill Moses first started playing for U.S. water polo, the team manager would pack a TV and VCR for overseas tournaments, and players would watch VHS tapes of their games. Tony Azevedo remembers waiting and waiting for the play he wanted to...
